title: 115_hr95
content: The Act titled "Veterans' Access to Child Care Act" provides child care assistance for veterans receiving mental health care and other intensive health care services from the Department of Veterans Affairs. The "Veterans' Access to Child Care Act" amends Title 38 of the United States Code to provide child care assistance for eligible veterans receiving mental health care and other intensive health care services from the Department of Veterans Affairs. Assistance includes a stipend for licensed child care centers. The "Veterans' Access to Child Care Act" provides child care assistance for eligible veterans, including a voucher program modeled after the Department of Veterans Affairs Child Care Subsidy Program. Assistance can be provided through direct provision of child care, payments to private child care agencies, collaborations with other federal departments, or other forms of assistance deemed appropriate by the Secretary. Stipends for child care must cover the full cost for eligible veterans who are primary caretakers of children. The "Veterans' Access to Child Care Act" provides child care assistance for eligible veterans who are primary caretakers of children and receiving or in need of covered health care services from the Department. Covered health care services include regular and intensive mental health care services determined by the Secretary to improve access for veterans. The "Veterans' Access to Child Care Act" aims to improve access to health care services for eligible veterans who are primary caretakers of children. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the relevant chapter. SEC. 3. Extension of reduction in pension amount for veterans covered by Medicaid plans for nursing facility services until September 30, 2026. SEC. 4. Extension of fee collection requirement for housing loans guaranteed by Secretary of Veterans Affairs. Section 3729(b)(2) of title 38, United States Code is amended to extend the deadline from September 30, 2024, to December 31, 2024, for various clauses related to veterans' benefits. Section 3729(b)(2) of title 38, United States Code is amended to extend the deadline to December 31, 2024, for clauses related to veterans' benefits. The House of Representatives passed the bill on July 28, 2017. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
